name: Bosnian Genocide (including Srebrenica)

mortality.note: Includes Srebrenica massacre (8,000+ men and boys in July 1995). 2.2 million displaced. Well-documented due to ICTY prosecutions.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Ethnic cleansing, concentration camps, Srebrenica massacre. Systematic targeting.
rationales.profit: Land and property seizure for ethnic homogeneity.
rationales.ideology: Serbian nationalism, Greater Serbia project. Ethnic purification.
rationales.complicity: Serbian military, paramilitaries, some civilians. UN failed to protect. ICTY prosecutions.

analysis.pattern_note: First genocide in Europe since WWII. Coined term 'ethnic cleansing'. UN peacekeepers present at Srebrenica but failed to prevent massacre. ICTY prosecutions established legal precedents. Demonstrates genocide can happen in modern Europe with international observers watching.
analysis.root_causes: Yugoslav collapse, Serbian nationalism, historical tensions, weak international response

erasure_note: National Library of Sarajevo deliberately targeted with incendiary shells (August 25-26, 1992). 1.5 million volumes and 155,000 rare books destroyed. Firefighters shot at by snipers. Unique records of Bosnian coexistence lost.

sources.title: Srebrenica: Record of a War Crime
sources.author: Jan Willem Honig

sources.title: The War in Bosnia-Herzegovina: Ethnic Conflict and International Intervention
sources.author: Steven Burg
